pullRequest.body:
Given two equivalence relations with `r ‚â§ s`, define an equivalence between a sigma type for the sum of the quotients by `r` on each equivalence class by `s`, and the quotient by `r`.

The motivating example is bijecting between orbits of an action by a subgroup: the orbits considered within each orbit of the action by the full group are equivalent to the orbits when the subgroup acts directly on the whole space.  This is a generic version for an arbitrary pair of setoids with `r ‚â§ s`, to be used in defining the version for orbits.

Feel free to golf or suggest a better name for the equivalence.

From AperiodicMonotilesLean.


---

nodes.body: üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by alreadydone.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8244226358/job/22546087800)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8244226358/job/22546087696)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8244226358/job/22546087489)

This works (and is computable):
```suggestion
def equivSigmaFibersOfLe {r s : Setoid Œ±} (hle : r ‚â§ s) :
    (Œ£ q : Quotient s, Quotient (r.comap (Subtype.val : Quotient.mk s ‚Åª¬π' {q} ‚Üí Œ±))) ‚âÉ 
      Quotient r :=
  .trans (.symm <| .sigmaCongrRight fun _ ‚Ü¶ .subtypeQuotientEquivQuotientSubtype
      (s‚ÇÅ := r) (s‚ÇÇ := r.comap Subtype.val) _ (fun _ ‚Ü¶ Iff.rfl) fun _ _ ‚Ü¶ Iff.rfl)
    (.sigmaFiberEquiv fun a ‚Ü¶ a.lift (Quotient.mk s) fun _ _ h ‚Ü¶ Quotient.sound <| hle h)
```
It also allow moving from `Mathlib.Data.Setoid.Partition` to `Mathlib.Data.Setoid.Basic` by removing the dependence on any definitions from the former, so I've now moved it to the latter, thanks!

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (Œ£ q : Quotient s, Quotient (r.comap (Subtype.val : Quotient.mk s ‚Åª¬π' {q} ‚Üí Œ±))) ‚âÉ ```

maybe call it
```suggestion
def sigmaQuotientEquivOfLe {r s : Setoid Œ±} (hle : r ‚â§ s) :
```
because the Sigma is in LHS, and this makes the order of words similar to that in `sigmaFiberEquiv`, which is used in the definition.

I think the capitalization of `Le` is correct here, because it's the decapitalization of `le` rather than capitalization of `LE`: I think `Le` should be used to refer to a hypothesis of the form `_ ‚â§ _` while `LE` should be used to refer to a typeclass argument `[LE _]`. However [ExistsMulOfLE](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Order/Monoid/Canonical/Defs.html#ExistsMulOfLE) and [maxOfLe](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Init/Prelude.html#maxOfLe) don't agree with me ...

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Data/Setoid/Basic): equivalence for quotients by two setoids
